title: Linux modprobe Command with Practical Examples
description: Learn how to use the modprobe command to load and remove kernel modules in Linux, with practical examples to enhance your system configuration and settings.

meta.title: Linux modprobe Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Learn how to use the modprobe command to load and remove kernel modules in Linux, with practical examples to enhance your system configuration and settings.
meta.keywords: Linux, modprobe, kernel modules, system configuration, system settings, load modules, remove modules

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of modprobe Command

verify.name: Verify the 'bridge' module is loaded
verify.hint: The 'bridge' module should be loaded after running 'sudo modprobe bridge'. Please check the output of 'lsmod' to verify.

verify.name: Verify the 'nfs' module is loaded
verify.hint: The 'nfs' module should be loaded after running 'sudo modprobe nfs'. Please check the output of 'lsmod' to verify.

verify.name: Verify the 'nfs' module is removed
verify.hint: The 'nfs' module should be removed after running 'sudo modprobe -r nfs'. Please check the output of 'lsmod' to verify.
